text: Following World War III, all the nations of the world agreed to 50 years of strict isolation from one another in order to prevent additional conflicts. 50 years later, the United States comes out of exile, only to learn that no one else went into isolation.

Following World War III, all the nations of the world agreed to 50 years of strict isolation from one another in order to prevent additional conflicts. 50 years later, the United States comes out of exile, only to learn that no one else went into isolation.  

It was hard to believe, but yes, the United States never realized that they were the only ones who stuck to strict isolation.  All the other countries and territories of the world decided to not let the USA know anything about it. They all went silent when it came to letting the USA know anything.  Of course, this was easy because all of the communications networks were destroyed during World War III. 

After coming out of isolation and beginning talks with the rest of the world, there was a noticeable difference with the USA.
